text:
Is there a way of doing essentially a vcat of tuples in a way that still allows the type of each element of the resultant tuple to be inferred at compile time?
My first instinct would be to do something like
```supertuple = (tuple1..., tuple2...)```
but I'm not sure this works as I've heard some bad things about the splat operator

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56493| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
Splatting is only a problem if the collection is large or if the length can't be inferred statically

elements.text: Splatting is only a problem if the collection is large or if the length can't be inferred statically

text: Hey <@UKHLCGXH6>, if you were able to find an answer here on Slack, please cross post it to Discourse via the link above. Thank you!
